intro: Argostemma roemeri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in cymes, and are surrounded by glandular hairs. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
